annotation.TEXT: SPREAD GUN EVERYTHING!!!
That last 3-way shot occurred after my star power ended, so it did use up ammo. Oh, well.
You can also vote for "Random" if you want, and you can also vote for YouTube to fix the stupid annoyances I'm having with the annotation editor. (I'm within the last 5% of the video now.)
Alright, now let's get started!
Oh, and I'm not going to show this on screen, but yes, you can save your game from the pause menu. (It actually saves as a .txt file to wherever you choose on your computer.)
Well, I didn't see any special explanations shown for this T-block here, so I'm assuming it controls the same as the regular Sophia III.
Unfortunately, there aren't very many enemies around to blast...
Umm... This missile isn't working? Oh, it must be the homing missile, which only fires if there are enemies present. Yep, that's what it is.
Oh, yes! The "S"! Me want that Spread Gun! Gimme! Gimme!
And now for an explanation of the character that I've chosen.
Zap! LOL!
Alright, I think that's enough for one video. So, the second half of world 1 is up ahead. Which two characters should I use for 1-3 and 1-4? Place your votes now!
YES!!! SO MUCH AWESOME POWER!!!
Oh, cool. Infinite ammo. Let's blast stuff!
You can set the controls, but I already have them set the way I want them.
Okay, so this "mushroom" powers up my gun (just like the "Hyper" upgrade from Blaster Master). Also, I picked up these missiles from the first Goomba, so let's try them out on something...

Oh, I got another upgrade from that "Fire Flower". Neat. This one's the "Hover" upgrade, which is the third upgrade you'd get in Blaster Master. I'm guessing additional "Fire Flowers" would continue giving me more upgrades until I have them all.
And, the demo resets, but with different graphics and music, since I have them set to "Random". Now, let's take a look at the menus, shall we?
Whoa! Looks like Atari 2600 graphics!
We're still in blocky Atari 2600 mode right now, which does look neat. Oh, and for the end-of-level flagpole, the game provides a small platform to allow anyone to hit the 5000 mark, which is nice.

I think that multi-coin blocks have a 15-coin limit, no matter how fast you hit them. (In the original SMB, the most you could get from a multi-coin block was 15 coins, or maybe rarely 16 if your timing was perfect and the game felt generous.)
Now, since I didn't touch the "Classic Scrolling" option in the Cheat menu, and it was turned off by default, I can indeed backtrack, and I'm going to do so just to visit this level's bonus room.
Ah, the hidden 1-up is of course in its usual spot. (Interestingly, the original NES Blaster Master had no 1-ups. I don't know about any of the sequels, though.)

Huh. There's a bunch of skins to choose from, including some "Probotector" ones. (I believe I read somewhere that Contra was remade as "Probotector" in Europe because they didn't like human-related violence, or something.)
Yep, only the Mario Bros. can actually do the classic "Goomba stomp"!
Oh, dear. Bill will always be a one-hit-point wonder, it seems. But, I bet his firepower will make up for that.
Looks like I can change the map skin from here too, as well as go with a randomly chosen character.
For Graphics, I want everything randomly available. Oh, and Game Boy Filter just makes everything look monochrome, but I want full color, so I'll leave that off.
"Mushroom"? That looked like Blaster Master's P-orb item instead. (But, it would look like a mushroom if Mario graphics were being used.)
Ooh, cool music for the invincibility! (Sorry that I collected the star so quickly that you couldn't really see what it looked like.)
May as well clean out the ? blocks that I skipped earlier too.
Oh, man. Time limit. That's okay, since I'm pretty much done here.
"F"? Really, game? Well, maybe the fire gun will be more useful here than it is in the original Contra.
Alright, so here's the character selection screen. Which one of these duders should I go with? Hmm...

I've been getting a lot of votes for this lately, and I've been interested in it myself too, so now it's time I finally started playing through this thing! But first, let's watch the title demo sequence, since it's kind of neat.
Hello, and welcome to Super Mario Bros. Crossover!
Well, I'll just go with the classic skin in the upper-left here.
Oh, they're the 3-way kind, which does use up three shots from the ammo counter at once (it worked that way in Blaster Master too).
Well, the 1-up looks like a 1-up mushroom for Bill. (Maybe the star looked like a star as well, but I had grabbed it so soon by accident.)
Interesting. The missile only stunned the koopa. I can still kick it, right?
Alright, and now, over three and a half minutes into the video, I'm finally actually playing! Yay!
MWAHAHAHA!!!
Alright, so who's next? I think I'll go with the Contra guy, Bill Rizer.
Well, I'm more at home with using the keyboard, but I do understand that some people would prefer a gamepad.
Oh, I guess I should turn on the Tutorials here. And, I'll leave Cheat Notify on and Lock Frame Rate off (I might turn on Lock Frame Rate later if it turns out to be necessary for some reason).
Oh, and the warp zone is over here like you'd expect, but I'm not actually going to warp. I just wanted to show it while destroying all of the bricks around here.

I'm not surprised that there's a coin block right there. I did the exact same thing when I remade 1-2 in an SMW hack, so that the player could still use the pipe, no matter how much destruction occurred.
I think I'll go with Sophia III from Blaster Master first. Oh, looks like I can choose which graphical skin I want for the character as well.

Yes, Mario just walked through a Shy Guy there without getting hurt. I guess he's immune to damage during the demo. (Sometimes the "Goomba" there gets destroyed before Mario reaches it in this title demo, though.)
Ooh, more item drops. There's more 3-way missiles from the brick, and a different kind of weapon from the Goomba. Also, the "Fire Flower" gives me the "Crusher" upgrade, further strengthening my gun.
I'm not going to bother looking at cheat unlock conditions right now, but if I happen to unlock cheats while playing normally, then great. (Maybe I'll look at all of the unlock conditions later.)
Oh, man. An "L". If I didn't already have this AWESOME SPREAD GUN, I'd totally try out the laser. Unfortunately, I already have this AWESOME SPREAD GUN, so I'm going to have to pass.
Oh, I so love this AWESOME SPREAD GUN!
Oh, and if you want me to use particular map skins, let me know, but I think I'd prefer to leave that as completely random.
There is this Cheat menu, but I'm not actually going to change any settings here, at least right now.
To be continued...
Looks like there were two additional coin blocks to the right of the multi-coin block for some reason. (Maybe to prevent certain characters from trapping themselves somehow?)
And now the theme has changed to Castlevania. Okay, let's see if I can get six fireworks this time.
Well, there's the original NES Tetris version, and the Tetris & Dr. Mario version. I'll pick the original Tetris version.
Uh, oh. Better not loiter around too much.
Ooh, the Goomba dropped something. Yeah, depending on who you're using, enemies might drop some relevant items.
Hmm... "Special"? What could that mean? Maybe we'll find out in the future...
So, until next time folks, when I take on the second half of world 1 with the help of a couple of these duders!

Alright, here's the tutorial text. I'll leave each page on the screen for several seconds so that you guys can read it. (Note that the controls shown in these explanations are based on what I have them set to. Obviously, they'll differ if you have them set differently.)

Oh, what's this? I unlocked a cheat somehow! Hmm... Knowing how much I tend to hang around in levels until time's almost up, this could be really handy. Hey guys, let me know if you want me to use the Infinite Time cheat later on, alright?
Oh, no. I'm out of Hover power! But, it does recharge over time, unlike in Blaster Master, which is nice.

The sound settings are already set to the way I want them. I have Music Console and Music Set at "Random", so anything could play. There's no "Random" for Coin Sound, so I'll just leave that as Normal.
Bah. I was one second too early to get six fireworks...
Nailed it!
Oh, man! I can play as a Tetris block! Yes, I'm totally going with the Tetrimino! But, which one? Hmm...
Alright, let's get started! Oh, looks like there's one more menu here. I'm not sure what Map Set and Map Difficulty affect, so I'll just leave those alone.
Now, that's how you empty a multi-coin block!
